Package com.chaione.contexthub.sdk

ContextHub SDK

See: Description

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    SensorPipelineListener
    Any class that wants to be notified for sensor pipeline events should implement this interface and register with ContextHub.addSensorPipelineEventListener
    SensorPipelinePayloadProvider  
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    BeaconProxy
    The Beacon Proxy is used to create, read, update, and delete beacons on ContextHub.
    BootCompletedReceiver
    Initializes ContextHub after a device boot completes
    ContextHub
    ContextHub manages the initialization of the ContextHub framework.
    DeviceProxy
    The Device Proxy is used to read and update devices on ContextHub.
    GeofenceProxy
    The Geofence Proxy is used to create, read, update, and delete geofences on ContextHub.
    IntentService
    Default intent service to listen for events.
    LocationService
    This service tracks the user's location and monitors the geofence activities
    LogProxy
    The Log Proxy is used to log information to the ContextHub server logs.
    ProximityService
    This service monitors beacon events
    PushNotificationProxy
    The Push Notification Proxy is used to send push notifications via ContextHub
    SensorPipeline
    The SensorPipeline monitors events as they are triggered.
    SensorPipelineEvent
    Context event metadata
    SubscriptionProxy
    The Subscription Proxy is used tell ContextHub that you want to be notified when tagged elements are created, updated, and deleted on the server.
    VaultProxy<T>
    The Vault Proxy is used to create, read, update, and delete custom data on ContextHub.

Package com.chaione.contexthub.sdk Description

ContextHub SDK

Include ContextHub as a library in your project

To integrate it into your project, extend the Application class and instantiate ContextHub in the onCreate method. 

ContextHub.init(this, "app-id");
To integrate push, also initiate Push in onCreate: 

Push.init(this, "GCM Project ID", YourActivity.class);

Include the following in your manifest: 

<uses-permission android:name="android.permission.INTERNET" />

 <!-- If you want to use Location or Geofences -->
 <uses-permission android:name="android.permission.ACCESS_FINE_LOCATION" />

 <!-- If you want to work with Beacons -->
 <uses-permission android:name="android.permission.BLUETOOTH" />
 <uses-permission android:name="android.permission.BLUETOOTH_ADMIN" />

 <!-- If you want to use push notifications -->
 <uses-permission android:name="android.permission.GET_ACCOUNTS" />
 <uses-permission android:name="android.permission.WAKE_LOCK" />
 <uses-permission android:name="com.google.android.c2dm.permission.RECEIVE" />

 <permission
      android:name="your.package.name.permission.C2D_MESSAGE"
       android:protectionLevel="signature" />

 <uses-permission android:name="your.package.name.permission.C2D_MESSAGE" />

 <!-- If you want to listen for Activity Recognition events -->
 <uses-permission android:name="com.google.android.gms.permission.ACTIVITY_RECOGNITION" />

And declare the following services/receivers: 

<!-- Handles all events and passes them along to the corresponding handlers -->
 <service
     android:name="com.chaione.contexthub.sdk.IntentService"
     android:enabled="true" >
 </service>

 <!-- Scans iBeacons -->
 <service
     android:name="com.chaione.contexthub.sdk.beacons.ScannerService"
     android:enabled="true"
     android:exported="false" />

 <!-- GCM Receiver for Push Notifications -->
 <receiver
     android:name="com.chaione.contexthub.sdk.push.GcmBroadcastReceiver"
     android:permission="com.google.android.c2dm.permission.SEND" >
     <intent-filter>
         <action android:name="com.google.android.c2dm.intent.RECEIVE" />

         <category android:name="your.package.name.android" />
     </intent-filter>
 </receiver>

 <!-- Optional boot completed receiver. Include this if you want to initialize ContextHub on boot. -->
 <receiver android:name="com.chaione.contexthub.sdk.BootCompletedReceiver">
     <intent-filter>
         <action android:name="android.intent.action.BOOT_COMPLETED" />
     </intent-filter>
     <meta-data
         android:name="com.chaione.contexthub.sdk.APP_ID"
         android:value="@string/default_app_id" />
 </receiver>
